storyInfo: Reunion, the 'Trilby Asher', Rhodes Island and Dublinn forces all converge on Norport, the situation growing further chaotic. There, Siege's status as Aslan royal family and the Sighs of Kings in her grasp render her the center of the maelstrom.

attributes.content: Right, now I remember. That's the Rhodes Island uniform.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Mr. Guard has a set of it, and if memory serves, Miss Susie went to some Rhodes Island after leaving Caladon too.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: They should be a good bunch. Why help Miss Susie otherwise?
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: And they're helping the Infected here too.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: *sigh* It's tough being the good ones. The good ones always choose too much responsibility for themselves.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: All while some responsibilities weren't meant for anyone to bear.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Poor Rhodes Island. Maybe they went down the wrong path from square one.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Just like Nine said, injections and tablets won't solve Oripathy. The body can hurt less, but others won't change the way they look at you so easily.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: We need to force them to see us, to hear our voices, to admit we're not just sores and ulcers on them.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: What do you think?
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: You've been with me long enough, friends. Any brilliant ideas about what I just mentioned?
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Reunion.
You aren't part of our objective.
So I'm guessing we can keep doing each to our own?
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Fine, leave then.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Well, since Dublinn is in the mix now, it's about time I get them evacuated.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Grr. If I had a little more time, I could've talked a few more people over.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: For now, let's go rendezvous with her.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: You call yourself a poet...
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Miss Ines. Another marvelous insight to share?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: I've met a few poets before, all far better than you, because—
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: They never misused their metaphors.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Dust, sandpaper...
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Out of this plate, this nation, even the entire land itself, who's the dust, and who's the sandpaper?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: And how are you qualified to decide who's who?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: War doesn't do metaphor in any way.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: It's not some terrific journey. It's not some furnace for glory once again. It's not some ship sailing for revival.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: It's just people struggling in mud. Arms broken in ruins. Stenches that never fade.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: That's all it is.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: ...I know that better than anyone.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: We can set aside our differences for now. I respect the views of a veteran mercenary.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: But I do need an answer as to my proposal for promoting from pawn to friend.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Here.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: She's agreed, as long as both we and her can leave this place alive.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: She's already left for the comms station. The broadcast will be out imminently.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: There's a shame. We didn't need to go that far.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: You've turned down an invitation from Victoria.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.options: The Duke of Caster can't stand for all of Victoria.;......;All I've turned down is a lousy poet.

attributes.content: She will.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Not a wise decision, I have to say.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Being clever won't help you, Doctor of Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Is this one of your little schemes too?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Delphine? What are you...
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Run! They're—
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: What a clamorous locale.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Should I refer to you as Captain of the Redsteel Guard, or 'The Brigadier' of Dublinn?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Such a surprise to see your people here.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Finally, an end to the slog.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Delphine and that Doctor will sort out that comms station, right?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: It'll all go smooth, and then we can leave Norport.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Figured out where you're off to after?
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: ...Dunno.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Anyone mucking in a Norport gang either came out an orphanage or plain lost anyone to fall back on.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Goes for us too pretty much, I figure.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: There'll be a way. We'll find some way to feed ourselves. Hah, maybe I'll go off and join those 'Rusthammers.' They love to tell stories about them, don't they.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Won't catch me dead being a duke's estate refugee at any rate, down on my knees begging those ivory tower shits for my bowl of gruel.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Cador—
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: I know. You think I'm still on about some naive shit, like 'ooh, let's knock the daylights out of the Sarkaz' was.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Baird, I've lost enough living through all this. I can't just abandon the final specks I still have.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: All this... pain, this torment, if it turns me, crushes me soft after all, then I may as well be dead in an alley.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: It's... maybe hard to criticize being crushed, Cador. Nobody's actually got a spine of steel.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: During the day, I went to the video shop. McClaren wasn't there fighting over that luggage thing of supplies, so I thought he might've had an accident.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: He always thinks everyone's up to something, the weirdo.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: You've gone and drunk plenty of his squash, haven't you.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Fine, then, may he live forevermore. He alright?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: ...He still alive?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Front of the video shop was wretched. I'd guess he's been raided a bunch.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: I tried calling for him, but no response. So I thought he was hiding somewhere else, until... I saw him. Through his window all nailed shut, just a crack left. Saw his eyes.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Bulging out of their sockets. Covered in blood. Terrified. Desperate. Didn't dare look at him again.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: He—
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: I don't think he can come out of there anymore.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: You say 'soft.' You call them that. But we know we're... not that far off ourselves.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: ...Hah.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: We still have a chance to save all this.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: It'll be tough. We'll have to survive the Sarkaz's likely counterattack, and then the artillery from the dukes' forces.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: But it's not at all impossible.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Right now, we need to figure out what moves the Sarkaz barracks are going to make against us...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Hrmph. Always on time to encourage us and remind us what we need to do, Your Majesty. How reliable of you.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Cador...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Oh, might I have the privilege of your orders again?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: I'm wondering... what would you say—a king is?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: What, you taking me in as your vassal?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: No, I've said it a thousand times, I'm just Vina of the Glasgow Gang.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I just... realized I never honestly thought about the question before.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Maybe I'm clueless how, aside from all that praise about honor and majesty, what a king is to you...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: No, to us, as a thing that exists.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: It doesn't. It's nothing.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: No king's ever meant shit to us. I'm happier giving my respect to the tuck shop owner who does a discount for me when I've not got enough in my purse.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Victoria's always had a king, since ancient times.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Yeah? And who were they? Because I'm terribly sorry, but I'm not some hoity-toity Aslan or Draco, and I've never met one neither.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: If they're nowhere except a few names in a book, then I know Chef Vito off the Siracusan restaurant ads better than I do them.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: We haven't had a king for how many years. Are our lives any worse?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Fine, maybe they are.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: But I really doubt it's anything to do with whether we've got a king or not. Don't care if it's you or whatever heavyweight taking the throne, you're not gonna be looking us down here in the eye.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: By your definitions, a foolish king gets lost in banquets and wine, while a wise king draws up war and taxes.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: If you ask me, it's ego-chasing no matter which. The vanity of thinking you can control everything, full stop.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Siege, everyone in Norport's bowing down to you as their one hope...
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: So you tell me. You having fun?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: You think saving them is your glorious bloody calling?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: I'd never say 'calling.' Never.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Just—
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Just, you think you've got some kind of responsibility. Like they're watching you and you need to answer them.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Some bloody mess you're in. Poor old Royal Highness.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: I'd ask, but you know full well. Are they willing to pin their sights on you because you're a member of a street gang—
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: —or because of your bombshell of a surname, 'Victoria?'
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: I'll be frank, I've just as much been hoping for someone to save all this, save all of us, save this bloody endless cesspit.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: And who's going to do that? Quit dreaming.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Daring to bear the responsibility's a fine moral thing that helps us muck our way in the streets, Siege.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: But don't give people false hope with that 'king' persona.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: And don't... ever buy—that they were right to expect this shit of you since the day you were born.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Got visitors.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Tch. Do we do them in?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Don't jump to anything. We don't want to tip them off. We just need a grasp of how they're deployed for now...
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Something's off. Be on high alert.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: You... lot...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Soldier

attributes.content: Don't get the wrong idea, sir, we're not here for trouble, just passing by...
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Baird! Didn't you say don't tip them off?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Shit—I didn't do anything!
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: This blood... He was already badly injured. He was fleeing this way.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Someone in the lockdown take him to task?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Don't think so. Not like we haven't tried before. Maybe there's a chance to take one or two out, but it's a whole army keeping us in here.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Even if a sneak attack goes well, they'll retaliate fast. Unless...
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Is it... usually this quiet around here?
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: From atop the zone's walls, searchlights throw down beams of death-pale white.
They're well-versed in the odors that pervade Norport, but here, the smell of fresh blood fills the air.
Get out of here, fast.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We need to gather every citizen we can still find on this plate.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: But we still don't have word back from Miss Ines and the Doctor.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: We'll just have to assume for now their side's going smooth.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Someone's already made a move here.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: You're sure?
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: I'm sure. That's an Aslan.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: She's not part of our objective.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: That's fine. She'll make the call herself.
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: Dammit, the door here's been sealed.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Doctor, stay behind me.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Everyone, a warm welcome to the Sunset Street Hotel. We haven't had this many esteemed visitors in a very long time.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: Colbert! I told you to stay hidden!
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Not receiving guests at the door would be my failure as the owner of a hotel.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: I'm very sorry for how limited we are under present conditions. I'd have some complimentary tea brought out to you all, otherwise.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: Is there anything I might be able to help you with?
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: Do you have normal water, then? I am, er... a bit thirsty, actually.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: That, I can serve you, Miss Delphine.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: Old Wellington wasn't willing to let this place off after all.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Nor Duke Caster.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Would you allow me to leave now?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: You and that blue-haired Feline are staying.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: I imagine the Duke of Caster and the Duke of Wellington have an unspoken agreement on the 'standing off against the Sarkaz' front.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: And as for the goals of each one of us... some unspoken agreement too.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: I simply obey the orders I receive.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Are all Tarans as dreary as you?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: My sense of humor is reserved for my friends.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Wonderful, I love making friends. Being fellow Victorians, why don't we start by complaining about the weather?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Yes, the weather... Londinium's has been horrible, and it's only getting worse.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: We actually saw the sun some days, forty years ago.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: Our hotel was much better then than now, too. What an incredible place it was!
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: I still remember to this day when I first came on as the doorman.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: I hear back then, even the dukes loved staying here!
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: Your presence isn't needed, Sarkaz.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Sir, I'm truly sorry, but it's my hope you'll regard me as a Victorian much like you.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: We are all the people of Victoria. What need do we have for tensions like this, no?
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: Rare to see a Sarkaz self-identifying as a Victorian.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Isn't your case much along the same lines as mine, Miss?
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: Us Sarkaz living outside of Kazdel have to find a home for ourselves, don't we?
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: I'm afraid most Sarkaz don't think so.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Hence why they're always so despondent, so weary.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: In my view, well, I've lived here all my life, and every wall and every floor is a familiar one to me, far more familiar than Kazdel so far away.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: Pardon my negligence these days, but I'd wipe every table spotless by myself in older times.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: I was proud of my work. You really should've seen what it was like back then.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: Oh, different times... they put me under the illusion that days like those would last forever.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: *sigh* But times like those come to an end.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: Percival, it really is a shame you came to work here after the place declined.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: To be honest, I don't really care that much.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: If it was as ravaged by war and shaken to rubble as everything else now, honestly, I might be taking things better myself.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: What hurts me is...
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: On an afternoon like all the afternoons that used to be, I finished wiping the tables, lifted my head—
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: And it suddenly hit me, how old everything around me was.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: And I was clueless how it even happened.
attributes.name: Colbert
